website_summaries.verdict: You'll pay a little extra for this touch mouse version, as it's designed to match Microsoft Surface hardware.
pros: Works with almost any non-Apple device that includes Bluetooth, but made specifically for Surface
Touch mouse allows for scrolling in any direction on the screen
This mouse has an automatic power down mode after a period of inactivity that will conserve battery power
cons: Some problems with usability of the mouse

customer_reviews.title: Fixed no Middle-Button deficiency, here's how
customer_reviews.text: This is literally one of the best mice I have ever used. The only down side is there is no middle-click. But I've found a workaround for this. I've written a script in AutoHotKey. When you press-and-hold the right click, you get a middle click. When you double click the right click, you get Task View (Win10). I'm sharing it here: Rbutton:: ;DELAYS SINGLE-CLICK 0.15sec HERE IN ORDER TO RECOGNIZE THE OTHER TWO keywait, rbutton, t0.15 if errorlevel = 1 { ;PRESS-AND-HOLD ACTION HERE send, {mbutton} return } else keywait, rbutton, d, t0.15 if errorlevel = 0 { ;DOUBLE-CLICK ACTION IS HERE send, #{Tab} return } else ;SINGLE-CLICK ACTION HERE (DELAYS 0.15sec) mouseclick, right return

4-way scrolling: Via a sleek touch strip, which allows you to scroll vertically or horizontally and use gentle swipes or quick flicks for versatile navigation.
Designed for Surface Windows 8 Pro and Surface Windows RT.
